meanings.definition: A stroke made in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her upstroke in tennis to improve her game.
meanings.sent2: The artist's brush made a smooth upstroke on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail made an upstroke as it pounced on the toy.
meanings.sent4: The kite soared higher with each upstroke of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful upstroke added elegance to her performance.

meanings.definition: The action of moving a pen or brush upwards in writing or painting.
meanings.sent1: His calligraphy improved with each careful upstroke of the pen.
meanings.sent2: She admired the artist's precise upstroke in the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The child giggled as he accidentally made an upstroke on his face with the paintbrush.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed smoothly with each deliberate upstroke of the pen.
meanings.sent5: The mural came to life with every colorful upstroke of the brush.

meanings.definition: A movement of a musical instrument bow in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The violinist's upstroke created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: He practiced the upstroke on the cello to perfect his technique.
meanings.sent3: The guitar player's upstroke accidentally hit the ceiling light, causing a flicker.
meanings.sent4: The conductor's upstroke signaled the start of the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The harpist's gentle upstroke added a magical touch to the music.
